definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The eldest Kasyapa's disciples were in rags and practiced a Dhuta practice.
sentences.chinese: 大伽叶的弟子衣衫褴褛，他们修的是头陀行。

sentences.english: Toutuoxing was one of the most common means of practicing Buddhism in the early Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 头陀行是早期佛教最常见的一种修持方式。

sentences.english: I am the foremost in ascetic virtues.
The Buddhist poems of BaZhiTouTuo reached the peak in the modern times .
sentences.chinese: 中国近代的禅诗至八指头陀而达于顶峰。

definition: the staff of a Buddhist monk
Buddhist monk's knife (not used for killing)
abbr. for 阿羅漢|阿罗汉[a1 luo2 han4]
monk (Sanskrit: Sramana, originally refers to north India)/Buddhist monk
kasaya, a patchwork outer vestment worn by a Buddhist monk
honored sir (a person of higher status or seniority, or a Buddhist monk)
